text: Frederick Hugh "Old Eagle Eyes" Lehman (October 27, 1885 â€“ April 12, 1961) was a Canadian ice hockey goaltender and coach. He played 48 games in the National Hockey League (NHL). He played with the Chicago Black Hawks. He is best known for his time in the PCHL with the Vancouver Millionaires/Vancouver Maroons. He spent 9 years with the franchise and won a Stanley Cup with them in 1914. He then spent 1 year with Chicago Black Hawks of the NHL and split the second year to coach them. After he retired, he worked in the road construction business and became the president of a paving company. Lehman was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in 1958. ==References== == Other websites == * Category:1885 births Category:1961 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey goaltenders Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Hockey Hall of Fame inductees Category:Ice hockey people from Ontario Category:People from Pembroke, Ontario Category:Stanley Cup champions
title: Hughie Lehman
